title: Former Home and Away's Patrick Noonan slams police as 'heavy handed' after conviction
text:
A former Home and Away actor has slammed 'heavy handed' bouncers and police after he was given a good behaviour bond for breaking a female officer's nose.

Keiren Patrick Noonan, 32, levelled the insults following his sentencing at Downing Centre Local Court in Sydney on Wednesday.

He had faced court over a drunken scuffle that unfolded at Cargo Bar in Darling Harbour on May 26 earlier this year.

Noonan had been approached by two plain clothes police officers after they saw him refusing to leave the popular Sydney nightspot.

A former Home and Away actor has slammed police as 'heavy handed' after he was given a good behaviour bond for breaking a female officer's nose (pictured, Kieren Patrick Noonan)

Keiren Patrick Noonan, 32, levelled the insults following his sentencing at Downing Centre Local Court in Sydney on Wednesday

As the police tried to arrest Noonan, he resisted, hitting the female officer standing behind him in the face, causing blood to gush out of her nose.

Noonan had previously denied assaulting the officer but entered a guilty plea to two counts before sentencing.

Outside court, Noonan said the police and bouncers had been heavy-handed during the incident and it could have been dealt with differently.

'I'm a convicted criminal now, for something ... that I didn't do, to be honest,' said Noonan.

'It's a disgrace that you can't even go out in the city anymore and enjoy a few drinks with your friends without ... being harassed by this gang that's dressed in blue and these bouncers that are just super thugs.'

Noonan said he'd told bouncers he just wanted to finish his drink, which they then grabbed out of his hand.

He said he was sorry for the injuries to the female officer.

'I didn't punch anybody … I wouldn't never punch a woman. I was raised single-handedly by my mother,' he said.

'She was standing behind me, I'm not sure how I could punch somebody if they're standing behind you.

Noonan said he'd told bouncers he just wanted to finish his drink, which they then grabbed out of his hand (pictured, Noonan in Home and Away)

Noonan (pictured, outside court) had faced court over a drunken scuffle that unfolded at Cargo Bar in Darling Harbour on May 26 earlier this year.

Noonan (pictured, outside court) had been approached by two plain clothes police officers after they saw him refusing to leave the popular Sydney nightspot

'Maybe the police in the city need to … get appropriate training.'

During sentencing, magistrate Gary Still accepted Noonan's injuring of the officer was 'reckless' and didn't appear to be deliberate.

'Yet again it's alcohol that explains the matter, but it's not the excuse for it,' he said.

'I think he understands that now.'

Noonan was sentenced to a 12-month community corrections order, 100 hours of community service and fined $750.
description: Keiren Patrick Noonan, 32, pleaded guilty to assaulting two police officers after he refused to leave Sydney's Cargo Bar in May.
authors: Aidan Wondracz For Daily Mail Australia
